sub_topic: Determining the rank of a matrix
message_1:
Determine the rank of the following matrix:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 8 & 12 \\ 2 & 4 & 6\end{bmatrix}$$
message_2:
To find the rank of the matrix, we need to perform Gaussian elimination to bring it to its row-echelon form and then count the number of non-zero rows.

Original matrix:
$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 8 & 12 \\ 2 & 4 & 6\end{bmatrix}$$

Step 1: Subtract 4 times the first row from the second row, and subtract 2 times the first row from the third row:
$$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0\end{bmatrix}$$

Now the matrix is in row-echelon form. There is only one non-zero row, so the rank of the matrix is 1.
